paper_title: Cycle type in Hall-Paige: A proof of the Friedlander-Gordon-Tannenbaum conjecture
abstract: An orthomorphism of a finite group $G$ is a bijection $φ\colon G\to G$ such that $g\mapsto g^{-1}φ(g)$ is also a bijection. In 1981, Friedlander, Gordon, and Tannenbaum conjectured that when $G$ is abelian, for any $k\geq 2$ dividing $|G|-1$, there exists an orthomorphism of $G$ fixing the identity and permuting the remaining elements as products of disjoint $k$-cycles. We prove this conjecture for all sufficiently large groups.
